meanings.definition: To incorrectly label or describe something in a caption.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally miscaptioned the photo, calling it a sunset when it was actually a sunrise.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure not to miscaption any images when posting them online.
meanings.sent3: The miscaptioned picture made everyone think the cat was a dog!
meanings.sent4: Her words miscaptioned the scene, painting a false picture in the viewers' minds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's miscaption of the historical event led to confusion among the students.

meanings.sent4: The miscaption acted like a disguise, hiding the true message behind a misleading label.
